column4: Can anyone on this earth please help me get unlimited bandwidth from my router?
Anyone?
Stop treating me like a nood and help me
How do you know that someone knows the answer?
There are a lot of smart guys.

That doesn't mean that someone knows the answer to your specific question. It might also help if you described your problem in more detail. What bandwidth are you getting now? What bandwidth do you expect?
I have 30GB bandwidth I am paying around 40$ in other words my ISP is robbing me. I was just curious to know if there is a way to bypass their shitty bandwidth limit. Sorry for language.
An apology in the same line as the offense you are apologising for is not sincere.
Okay sorry.
Please pastebin your complete .bashrc
There is no need. Just tell me what should I add in the .bashrc, something that compiles though.
There is a need, as what you've already been given is correct, which means that something else is wrong with your .bashrc.
http://pastebin.com/zhekmATQ
You forgot the spaces. Copy and paste exactly what heoyea gave you.
Again, syntax error.
Please pastebin your new .bashrc .
Copy pasted it perfectly. Ok, and thanks.
http://pastebin.com/RJqbwyYD
You're still missing spaces. Please litteraly use copy and paste.
Ahh, I see the problem now :)

What heoyea gave you *was* incorrect, but when you repeated it, saying "I added 'nameiwant() { echo hello; }' and it didn't work." what you posted was actually correct :) If you use exactly 'nameiwant() { echo hello; }' it will work :)
Perfect, now, help me achieve this 'rn fileName' will do this 'javac hello.java' and then 'java hello'?
Thanks a lot.
You're welcome.
